question: Was prehospital transdermal glyceryl trinitrate effective for stroke in the RIGHT-2 trial?
ideal_answer: No. Prehospital treatment with transdermal glyceryl trinitrate did not improve functional outcome in patients with presumed stroke.

snippets.text: INTERPRETATION: Prehospital treatment with transdermal GTN does not seem to improve functional outcome in patients with presumed stroke.
Conclusions- Prehospital treatment with GTN worsened outcomes in patients with intracerebral hemorrhage.
